newsitem.title: USA: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Cisco busy as stock whips around.
newsitem.headline: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Cisco busy as stock whips around.

text.p: Options on shares of Cisco Systems Inc were busy as the stock bounced in a wide range on heavy volume, traders said Tuesday.
Cisco shares ended up 1/4 at 48-3/8 on heavy turnover of nearly 12.6 million shares.
The stock fell off the open to 46-3/8 before recovering to climb as high as 49-1/8.
Patrick Hamilton at LETCO said early options activity was from shorts but that the main action was from investors doing the April 45 and May 45 time spread.
He said one investor was a particularly big seller of that time spread.
"May is earnings month, so I'm assuming they were trying to position themselves a little bit for the May earnings," Hamilton said.
The Cisco April 45 put traded 5,535 contracts and the May 45 put traded about 3,725.
Other busy Cisco options included the April 50 call which traded nearly 4,000 contracts, the April 50 put which traded about 2,210, and the April 60 call which traded 1,395.
Hamilton said volatility in Cisco options rose a few points early on as the stock declined, but came in later in the session as the stock settled into a range.
He said that over the last few days, volatility has climbed three to four points to the mid-50 region.
Elsewhere, big volume was seen in the RJR Nabisco Holdings Corp June 40 call, where 7,255 contracts changed hands. The option, which was unchanged at 3/8, had open interest of 12,188.
RJR shares eased 3/8 to 31-7/8.
Several Informix Corp options saw solid volume as the stock slumped 5-7/32 to 9-29/32 on turnover of more than 24 million shares.
The stock fell after the company said it expected to report a "substantial" first quarter loss on far weaker than expected sales. It hit a session low of 8-3/4.
The most active Informix option was the May 12-1/2 call, with total volume of about 1,170 contracts. The option, which lost 2-11/16 to 9/16, had open interest of 136 contracts.
Several hundred contracts traded in the April 10 puts and calls, the April 12-1/2 calls and the April 15 puts.
Trading was also fairly brisk in several May and August calls, particularly the 12-1/2 and 20 strikes.
Most of the volume crossed on the Chicago Board Options Exchange. The options also trade on the American Stock Exchange.
